_comment: Benchmark pass/fail targets for OCTOREFLEX. Edit to tighten targets as the system matures.

containment_latency_p50_us.description: Median BPF LSM hook enforcement latency. Sub-millisecond is the primary claim.

containment_latency_p99_us.description: 99th percentile enforcement latency. Must stay under 2ms to avoid disrupting legitimate traffic.

cpu_idle_avg_pct.description: Agent CPU% with no monitored process activity. Target: < 0.5% on a 2-core host.

cpu_idle_max_pct.description: Peak agent CPU% at idle. Spikes above 2% indicate ring buffer processing bursts.

cpu_storm_avg_pct.description: Agent CPU% under 100k syscalls/sec (stress-ng --syscall). Includes BPF hook overhead.

cpu_storm_max_pct.description: Peak agent CPU% under syscall storm. Sustained peaks above 15% indicate ring buffer saturation.

fpr_pct.description: False positive rate over 10,000 normal-process samples. FPR > 0.5% is operationally unacceptable.

budget_exhaustion.description: Agent must remain alive and responsive after token bucket exhaustion.

kernel_stability.description: Zero BPF verifier errors, kernel oops, or panics in dmesg during 60s stress-ng run.

ransom_contained.description: Synthetic ransomware (entropy spike) must be contained (file_open blocked) within 5s.

ransom_latency_s.description: Time from ransomware entropy spike onset to first file_open block.
